startups.name: Tiller Systems
startups.tagline: More than just a point of sale
startups.info: A smart Point of Sale solution that merchants love. Tiller is a cool iPad-based cash register that brings all the data to the merchants through smart analytical reports and recommendations that help them save time, increase sales, and grow their business.

startups.name: Pour-Combien.com
startups.tagline: Get connected with safe and reliable help in your neighborhood
startups.info: Pick up the children after school, go to the dry cleaner, clean the house, prepare your moving and packing day, handiwork, gardening... There is never enough time in a day to get it all done! With our plateform, you are connected with safe and reliable help in the neighborhood to get your things done.  We are building a trustworthy community of people you can rely on anytime. Outsource your household errands and skilled tasks to trusted taskers in your community, or help your neighbors get their to-do’s done!

startups.name: Noosfeer
startups.tagline: Expanding information access to everyone
startups.info: Noosfeer is a web-app for reading web content while reducing mobile data usage. It has been meticulously designed for encouraging people to read more; hence, Noosfeer readers can access their articles at any time, anywhere. It works offline, without downloading a native app. Noosfeer has been created to offer a great reading experience across all mobile devices. From the latest iPhone to the oldest smartphone.

startups.name: La Box Culturelle
startups.tagline: The Best way to boost your cultural life
startups.info: Hard to choose from the wide range of events in the Parisian cultural scene. It’s usually expensive and a hassle. For people who hate to queue for tickets and waste their time surfing the web, we select the best art, theatre and culture! Every month, get a box filled with gifts and invitations to cultural events, for Parisians in a hurry who run out of ideas. Inside you will find tickets for the best plays, exhibitions and events, and a surprise gift (i.e. CD, DVD, or books)!

startups.name: Artchy
startups.tagline: Unlocking the archives
startups.info: 80% of the world’s records are sealed in boxes and many traces of human kinds biggest achievements are on their way to disappear because there is no money to digitize them. That’s why we’ve created Artchy, a unique marketplace between historical repositories and the people seduced by one exciting promise: feeling the thrill of owning a limited edition of a never-before-seen archive – one that resonates with their own passion for an iconic figure or special moment.

startups.name: BackMarket
startups.tagline: The anti planned obsolescence shop
startups.info: Back market is the first marketplace exclusively dedicated to refurbished products. Our mission is to make the consumption of those refurbished devices cool, ethic and mainstream.

startups.name: UniqueSound
startups.tagline: Videos will never sound the same
startups.info: to be filled up for each startup

startups.name: Soundsgood
startups.tagline: Music curated with passion
startups.info: Soundsgood is a new kind of music service where people listen to playlists curated with passion by top influencers. DJs, artists, medias and eclectic music lovers share their selections with Soundsgood to guide the music discovery of their audiences among the tons of songs coming out these days.

startups.name: Smyle
startups.tagline: The firs bag and shoes visual comparison engine
startups.info: Smyle is the first visual comparison engine for fashion. Thanks to the automatic understanding of the style of bags and shoes, Smyle guides the customer towards the best product at the best price.

startups.name: Jam
startups.tagline: Every Student’s personal Assistant
startups.info: Jam is every student’s personal assistant. It is a mobile app for new generation students to experience college life to the fullest. We want our users to focus on the positives of what being in college entails not the negatives: Stress brought by the chalenges of finding internships, events to go to, housing, etc. Our goal is for students to just be students. Not housing-seekers, internships-sekers, or events-seekers; just students. And enjoy it.

startups.name: Birdly'
startups.tagline: Focus on what matters in your job
startups.info: Birdly tackles the trivia of expense reports and helps professionals focus on what matters most. Birdly is the first employee-centric mobile application that makes the expense reporting experience completely seamless. We extract information from receipts and use data intelligence to determine the relevant client, project, or travel context of the expense.

startups.name: Sharette
startups.tagline: Sharette is a market place dedicated to mobility in urban areas, combining short-distance carpooling with the existing network of public transports.
startups.info: to be filled up for each startup

startups.name: Nunki
startups.tagline: By the people, for the people
startups.info: Nunki digs deep into social media in order to find the most amazing stories and content. Thanks to a powerful location-based technology processing millions of data in real time, Nunki helps media groups and brands to remove noise and make the most out of user-generated content. Nunki is also a free iPhone app that is pioneering in how it keeps up to date with breaking news and live entertainment, by bringing its users closer to the heart of the action, side by side with people already there.

startups.name: Pulpix
startups.tagline: Engage your viewers
startups.info: Pulpix turns your videos into customers acquisition channels, with a technology that displays calls-to-action directly within the video, called inVideo Cards. Pulpix offers different cards to match different objectives: Email Card to compile lists of emails, Social Card to capture fans and followers, Page Card to convert viewers into visitors, Shopping Card for one-click purchase, App Card for instant downloads from videos, etc. All these cards integrate seamlessly with your day to day business tools (Mailchimp, Salesforce, etc.)

startups.name: SharePay
startups.tagline: Pay Together
startups.info: SharePay adresses the universal problem of daily shared expenses. Lea is a connected payment card designed for young couples. With each payment, it directly debits the personal card of each one, in real time.

startups.name: Drust
startups.tagline: Be a Superdriver
startups.info: Akolyt from Drust is a dongle that connects the heart of your car to your smartphone. Once plugged on the diagnostic socket of your car, it syncs with a user-friendly and community app via Bluetooth. It brings its user individualized advice and solutions to drive smarter and save money on gas, insurance and repair. On the long run, the service aims to reduce the total cost of car ownership while it gives drivers the keys to a smarter mobility. Plug your Akolyt in. Be a Superdriver.
